description: Front porch extension (following demolition of existing front porch); installation of single ply flat roof over porch; single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing rear addition); alterations to side elevation fenestrations; construction of single storey detached garden outbuilding to be used as workshop (following demolition of existing outbuilding)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: 026-100(00) Rev P01, 026-100(01) Rev P01, 026-100(02) Rev P01, 026-200(01) Rev P01.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the rear extension hereby approved shall match the appearance of those of the existing building as closely as possible.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (2021) policy D3 and National Planning Policy Framework (2024). | No part of the roof of the rear extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024). | The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall be used only for domestic purposes incidental to the dwelling on this site, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, letting or any commercial use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).
